description: Gets the properties associated with a medical entities detection job. Use this operation to get the status of a detection job.

parameters.name: JobId
parameters.description: The identifier that Amazon Comprehend Medical generated for the job. The StartEntitiesDetectionV2Job operation returns this identifier in its response.

nested_items.name: ComprehendMedicalAsyncJobProperties
nested_items.description: An object that contains the properties associated with a detection job.

nested_items.name: JobId
nested_items.description: The identifier assigned to the detection job.

nested_items.name: JobName
nested_items.description: The name that you assigned to the detection job.

nested_items.name: JobStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the detection job. If the status is FAILED, the Message field shows the reason for the failure.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: A description of the status of a job.

nested_items.name: SubmitTime
nested_items.description: The time that the detection job was submitted for processing.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: The time that the detection job completed.

nested_items.name: ExpirationTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that job metadata is deleted from the server. Output files in your S3 bucket will not be deleted. After the metadata is deleted, the job will no longer appear in the results of the ListEntitiesDetectionV2Job or the ListPHIDetectionJobs operation.

nested_items.name: InputDataConfig
nested_items.description: The input data configuration that you supplied when you created the detection job.

nested_items.name: S3Bucket
nested_items.description: The URI of the S3 bucket that contains the input data. The bucket must be in the same region as the API endpoint that you are calling.

nested_items.name: S3Key
nested_items.description: The path to the input data files in the S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: OutputDataConfig
nested_items.description: The output data configuration that you supplied when you created the detection job.

nested_items.name: S3Bucket
nested_items.description: When you use the OutputDataConfig object with asynchronous operations, you specify the Amazon S3 location where you want to write the output data. The URI must be in the same region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The location is used as the prefix for the actual location of the output.

nested_items.name: S3Key
nested_items.description: The path to the output data files in the S3 bucket. Amazon Comprehend Medical creates an output directory using the job ID so that the output from one job does not overwrite the output of another.

nested_items.name: LanguageCode
nested_items.description: The language code of the input documents.

nested_items.name: DataAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that gives Amazon Comprehend Medical read access to your input data.

nested_items.name: ManifestFilePath
nested_items.description: The path to the file that describes the results of a batch job.

nested_items.name: KMSKey
nested_items.description: The AWS Key Management Service key, if any, used to encrypt the output files.

nested_items.name: ModelVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the model used to analyze the documents. The version number looks like X.X.X. You can use this information to track the model used for a particular batch of documents.
